page.title: 09A South Clevedon Personality
page.content: Mrs. Hilda Baker,who is a local {councillor,}came to talk to us about the {history and future development}of Clevedon. She told what her life had been like. She came to Clevedon at the age of 17 as a member of the Land Army. She was paid fifteen shillings a week by Farmer Marshall, for whom she worked. 15 shillings is equal to 75p. She had to milk cows by hand and generally help on the farm. She told us that the site on which our school, Yeo Moor, stands had once been Tutton's Farm. Mrs. Baker left some deeds with us, dating back to the 15th century. We found out that some of the new roads in Clevedon are named after important people who used to live here. She also told us that the { {Triangle}is going to be developed into a{pedestrian precinct.}
